content:
in #89316 I am adding the ability to specify any number of clobber_abi arguments to asm. However there are often a lot of aliases for the same ABI, for example C == system on all current targets. Should there be detection and a warning/lint/error for when redundant clobber_abi are specified?

cc @Amanieu
I don't think that's needed. Often you'll just be copying the ABI directly from whatever function you are using and don't want to have to deal with the difference between "C" and "system".
